did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections and Archives, Johnston Memorial Library, Virginia State University
did.abstract: Thomas B. Patterson was a student at Hampton Normal and Agricultural Institute in 1888. Among his papers as a charter of a proposed normal school in Bullock County, in the state of Alabama. One member of the board was Booker T. Washington. There is also an interesting letter from Thomas Fortune. Acc # 1913-23- S.B.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Thomas Patterson Papers, 1913-23 , Special Collections and Archives, Johnston Memorial Library, Virginia State University, Petersburg, VA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Was in Johnston Memorial Library in 1976.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Thomas B. Patterson was born in South Carolina in 1866. He graduated from the Hampton Normal and Agricultural Institute in 1890. In 1908 he joined the faculty at Livingston College where he remained for two years. Mr. Patterson also worked as the county farm demonstration agent in Rowan County, North Carolina, before coming to Virginia as district agent for agricultural development and was based at Virginia State University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Interesting letter from T. Thomas Fortune expressing their pleasure regarding the policies of Booker T. Washington.
